summary.p: Recommends the Austrian nobleman [Balthasar von Kuenring], who is looking for an evangelical preacher; Werner Steiner is to accompany him. Bullinger should have [Kuenring] show Zwick's legal opinion on marriage and bring his own response to Zwick's attention. Greetings. [Kuenring] should be recommended to Grynäus.

div.p: The bearer of this letter is a nobleman from Austria, a skilled young man, whom I commend to you. He wishes to have the Gospel preached in his domain, provided he knows of a capable fellow. He must, however, proceed cautiously at first, but he will discuss this with you himself. In the matter of the Lord's Supper, the good man, as far as I understand, is somewhat inclined, but he is entirely fair. Dear friend, ensure that Master Werner Steiner accompanies him and that he makes a good impression on the Austrian.

He has pressed me to express my opinion on the marriage of cousins. For he himself desires to marry his cousin. I could not send you a copy of my judgment, but I would like you to request it from him. Then I ask you not to hesitate to let me know what you have replied to him.
Farewell with the pious brothers. I wish Pellican well.
Recommend the departing one to Grynäus
To the most honorable Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, Antistes of the Church of Zurich, dearest brother.
